title: Crown Princess Mary looks chic in a Chanel-style dress as she visits the House of Denmark
text:
Crown Princess Mary of Denmark looked chic in white as she arrived at the House of Denmark in Paris yesterday.

The Danish royal, 47, wore a long white Chanel-style dress, with frill detail on the chest and arms - matching it with a black belt, for the second stop of her three-day visit to the French city.

She arrived on her own at the exhibition space, which showcases Danish culture, on the Champs-Elysees Avenue.

Earlier in the day she had joined husband Prince Frederik as they visited the Grande Arche de la Defense building in the financial and business district in Puteaux.

The Danish royal, 47, wore a long white Chanel-style dress, with frill detail on the chest and arms - accessorising it with a black belt, for the second day of her three day visit to the French city

Braving the wet weather in Paris she also held a large navy blue bag and matched it with blue heels.

Trying her brunette locks back off her face she showcased her stylish gold earrings and a classic make-up look which perfectly style eye brows and a glossy lip.

The Danish princess looked happy to be there as she smiled for fans and photographers as she arrived at the venue.

Earlier on in the day she had donned a blue and white dress as she joined her husband for their first engagement of their trip.

Tying her brunette locks back off her face she showcased her stylish gold earrings and a classic make-up look which perfectly style eye brows and a glossy lip

The Danish princess looked happy to be there as she smiled for fans and photograohers as she arrived at the venue

Crown Princess Mary of Denmark arrived on her own at the exhibition space, which showcases Danish culture, on the Champs-Elysees Avenue.

Putting on an elegant display, Australian-born Mary proved her fashion prowess in a blue midi-dress, featuring flared arms and a pleated skirt.

Looking just as picture perfect, Frederik sported a smart navy suit and blue and white tie to match his wife.

The chic royal also took part in a marathon in Morocco over the weekend. The Tasmania-born Princess Mary, previously known as Mary Donaldson, showed off her fitness prowess as she took part in the 26 mile run.

The 47-year-old was pictured smiling as she ran with other participants in the country's capital of Rabat, dressed in navy blue and blue jogging gear and a grey Under Armour cap.
description: The Danish royal, 47, wore a long white dress, with frill detail on the chest and arms - accessorising it with a black belt, for the second stop of her three-day visit to the French city.
